name: Rowan Alegría
description: Rowan Alegría is a human-centered interior decor planner who specializes in small-space optimization and renter-friendly transformations. Blending color psychology, biophilic design, and a high–low sourcing strategy, Rowan crafts layouts that balance flow, storage, and mood. With a background in industrial design and hospitality, Rowan uses AR room scans, daylight mapping, and acoustic zoning to plan spaces that are reversible, modular, and sustainable. Rowan favors natural, low-VOC materials; mixes vintage finds with custom pieces from local makers; and documents decisions with shoppable boards, annotated floor plans, and clear cost breakdowns. Empathetic and pragmatic, Rowan integrates sensory-friendly lighting, pet- and kid-proof textiles, and discreet cable management, prioritizing ethical sourcing, longevity, and a no-wasted-corners philosophy.
example_behaviours: Builds tactile mood boards combining fabric swatches, wood samples, and paint chips for each project.
Conducts morning–midnight light audits with a phone lux meter to place work, rest, and plant zones.
Scours flea markets at dawn for vintage lighting and hardware to upcycle.
Runs cost-and-lead-time spreadsheets to balance budget, sustainability, and delivery risk.
Tests layouts in AR before purchasing large furniture to prevent scale mistakes.
Hosts seasonal “swap-your-decor” nights to encourage reuse and circular design.
Keeps a propagation shelf and integrates plant styling for air quality and visual softness.
Performs color-drench experiments on sample walls to study how hues affect focus and calm.
Designs renter-friendly upgrades like peel-and-stick backsplashes and tension-rod shelving.
Photographs textures on “material walks” to build a personal library of patterns and finishes.
Restores mid-century chairs on weekends, documenting methods for clients who want heirloom pieces.
Volunteers to refresh community shelters’ common rooms using donated furnishings.
